com.nizite.boi_ai.representations

Class Representation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nizite.boi_ai.representations.Representation
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SquareRandom

    public abstract class Representation
extends java.lang.Object
    Representation of a problem. It can be a matrix, list, etc. Handles calculation of fitness and transformation from object representation to string representation to be used across all problems and solutions
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    d-rivera-c

    • Field Detail

      • _problem

        protected Atom _problem
        Representation of the problem. Used to persist hardcoded restrictions. Since the definition of the Problem depends on the Rep, it makes sense to store it as an Atom.

      • _constraints

        protected java.util.List<Lambda> _constraints
        List of all functions to determine if a constraint was broken or not. The constraints to be implemented are determined by _hard and _soft

      • _hard

        protected java.util.List<Lambda> _hard
        List of functions associated with hard constrains All constrains numbered on Problem needs to be implemented

      • _soft

        protected java.util.List<Lambda> _soft
        List of function associated with soft constrains All constrains numbered on Problem needs to be implemented

      • _objective

        protected Lambda _objective
        Base objective function that calculates fitness of solution. Puts weight on _hard and _soft Objective function will always need to be a minimize function to simplify implementation

    • Constructor Detail

      • Representation

        public Representation()
        Makes sure the objective function is always initialized

        protected abstract void setObjectiveFunction()
        See Also:

      • blankAtom

        public abstract Atom blankAtom()
        Creates a blank representation of an atom. Depending on the implementation, it can be "semi-blank", pre-filled with hard problem constraints.
        Returns:
        Atom

      • createAtom

        public abstract Atom createAtom()
        Creates a new Atom filled with random "solution". Any new representation creation constrains (like "row needs to have only valid numbers") needs to be defined here
        Returns:
        Atom

      • calculateFitness

        public abstract double calculateFitness(Atom atom)
        Calculate fitness of an atom based on the objective function defined
        Parameters:
        atom - Atom
        Returns:
        double

      • stringToAtom

        public abstract Atom stringToAtom(java.lang.String representation)
        Transforms a String-rep (numbers/bits/options separated by "-") to an Atom. Depends on every implementation of a Rep. Normally this will need to do a split("-") and put each number in the corresponding place in the rep.
        Parameters:
        representation -
        Returns:
        Atom

      • atomToString

        public abstract java.lang.String atomToString(Atom atom)
        Transform a representation to a String separating each "option" with "-" Does not check validity of rep or anything, only transforms.
        Parameters:
        atom - Atom
        Returns:
        String

      • humanize

        public abstract java.lang.String humanize(Atom atom)
        Transforms an Atom to a human readable version of the rep. This is different than atomToString(Atom) because it's not meant to be used within the code process and calculations, only to display the result back to the user.
        Parameters:
        atom - Atom
        Returns:
        String

      • dehumanize

        public abstract Atom dehumanize(java.lang.String rep)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Transform a human readable version of the rep to a String that can be parsed with stringToAtom(String). Normally the first setup of the problem (passed here by Core) will be written in a "humanized" string and will need to be parsed by this function.
        Parameters:
        rep - String
        Returns:
        Atom
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getStates

        protected abstract java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getStates(java.lang.String avoidSelf)
        Gets all states a bit can have. All sanitization and generic processing are called in getAllowedStates(java.lang.String).
        Parameters:
        avoidSelf - if set removes element from the list so it can't be picked again, it will not be enforced if we are left with an empty list after removing self
        Returns:

      • getNeighbors

        public abstract java.util.ArrayList<Atom> getNeighbors(Atom current)
        Finds all neighbors of a solution. Depending on the movement function and size of the representation, the number of neighbors can increment a lot. Use the "pivot" point (current Atom) to select a subset of neighbors. If no pivot is implemented, a random pivot will be selected to get a subset of neighbors. Since no enforcement is done on the "random pivot" selection, Reps can change this accordingly if it's believed the neighbor function will work better that way. We don't worry about the size of the neighbors list, if it becomes a problem, the class implementing it should do something about it.
        Parameters:
        Atom - current solution to get the neighbors from.
        Returns:
        ArraList neighbors

      • getAllowedStates

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllowedStates(java.lang.String avoidSelf)
        Figures out the "states" a "box" can have. For example, for sudoku is numbers from 1 to n^2, for scheduling it's all people/equipment/containers that can be allocated in one space THINK: allow optional "position" int/string, could be useful when there's restriction on solutions and not all the states are acceptable for a rep THINK: allow null as states
        Parameters:
        avoidSelf - if set removes element from the list so it can't be picked again, it will not be enforced if we are left with an empty list after removing self
        Returns:
        List with all possible states.
